rename.from: Setup() function creates an iteration metric
rename.to: setup() function creates an iteration metric

body:
This is the problem on the k6 side: https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/blob/c68a4eb450aa0a806b16bef3206ba2163f05e2a7/stats/cloud/collector.go#L321-L324
Though the backend also makes a similar assumption, so we'll have to fix that as well, to fully resolve this.

This was fixed in https://github.com/grafana/k6/pull/1203 

But it still emit `iteration_duration` which is a bit strange IMO :thinking: 

Do you want to close this @sniku?
So you want completely not emit anything from `setup` and `teardown` and their duration?
I think it makes sense to be consistent :-) If we don't emit iteration, we should not emit iteration_duration.

issue.title: K6 contradicts itself in iteration statistics

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Brief summary

I have a test that starts with a Keycloak authentication call within the setup() function. Each iteration contains a single request. 

At the end K6 reports 48 iterations and 49 requests, as it should. I.e. it doesn't count the Keycloak request as an iteration.

However, in the iteration duration statistics, the minimum value is exactly the duration of the Keycloak request. 

In other words, K6 contradicts itself. In the iteration count, the Keycloak request is not treated as an iteration. In the stats, it is.

The Keycloak request ought not to be part of the iteration duration statistics. Or even the http request statistics. It's just a  preparatory step. It's not Keycloak that I'm testing here.

![image](https://github.com/grafana/k6/assets/8545060/f87227fd-b165-4af3-9ea4-c9107ec38f9d)


![image](https://github.com/grafana/k6/assets/8545060/cf6d9265-6a96-4e33-99ad-beab452eaeeb)



### k6 version

0.45.0

### OS

WSL2 Ubuntu 20.04

### Docker version and image (if applicable)

_No response_

### Steps to reproduce the problem

run a test that starts with a Keycloak authentication call, inside a setup() function

### Expected behaviour

The Keycloak call should not be counted as an iteration and contribute to the iteration duration stats. 

### Actual behaviour

The Keycloak call is not counted as an iteration BUT contributes to the iteration duration stats.

issue.title: present setup() function breaks iteration_duration metric

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Brief summary

If a setup function is present the iteration_duration metrics are wrong.
It seems that the time used to run `setup()` is incorporated into the `iteration_duration` metric. 

Maybe related to #2718

### k6 version

v0.51.0

### OS

Linux

### Docker version and image (if applicable)

_No response_

### Steps to reproduce the problem

* `script.js`
```
import { sleep } from 'k6';

export function setup() {
}

export default function() {
  sleep(1);
}
```

### Expected behaviour

iteration_duration metrics (avg, min, med, max, p(90), p(95)) are all 1s.

```
     data_received........: 0 B 0 B/s
     data_sent............: 0 B 0 B/s
     iteration_duration...: avg=1s min=1s med=1s max=1s p(90)=1s p(95)=1s
     iterations...........: 1   0.999474/s
     vus..................: 1   min=1      max=1
     vus_max..............: 1   min=1      max=1
```

### Actual behaviour

iteration_duration min shows a very low value:
```
     data_received........: 0 B 0 B/s
     data_sent............: 0 B 0 B/s
     iteration_duration...: avg=500.52ms min=1.67s med=500.52ms max=1s p(90)=900.94ms p(95)=950.99ms
     iterations...........: 1   0.998617/s
     vus..................: 1   min=1      max=1
     vus_max..............: 1   min=1      max=1
```
The time used to run `setup()` is incorporated into the `iteration_duration` metric.
If put a `sleep(1)` into the setup function the metric appears correct.

issue.title: Drop NetTrail - emit iterations metrics in runner instead of dialer

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
## What?

Drop the NetTrail container and emit iterations metric in runner instead of in Dialer.

Also fix #1605 

## Why?

As part of looking over issues I found #1250 which has some additional work required. But dropping the specific NetTrail and moving the code around was really simple. 

FIxing some of the test took a bit more time :(

## Checklist

-->

- [ ] I have run tests locally (`make tests`) and all tests pass.
- [ ] I have commented on my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas.
<!-- - [ ] Any other relevant item -->

## Related PR(s)/Issue(s)

#1605
